Legal_Issue: Whether the officer's decision to deny the applicant's pre-removal risk assessment application was procedurally fair
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution risk from FARC in Colombia
Officer questioned credibility due to insufficient evidence
FARC's human rights violations were acknowledged
Court_Ruling: Officer's decision overturned due to lack of oral hearing
Defendant_Behavior: Denial of pre-removal risk assessment without oral hearing
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Procedural_Issue: Lack of oral hearing despite credibility being central
Credibility_Assessment: Officer implied insufficient evidence to establish credibility
Evidence_Used: Evidence regarding FARC's human rights violations
Application_Basis: Pre-removal risk assessment under immigration law
Relief_Sought: Judicial review and remand for redetermination
Governing_Rule: Oral hearing required if credibility is central to decision
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient evidence to support credibility
Outcome: Case remanded to a different officer for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Potential risk of persecution if returned to Colombia
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution by FARC due to political activities
Evidence_Handling: Written submission without opportunity for oral clarification
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient documentation or testimony to prove claim
Evidence_Assessment: Negative due to lack of supporting evidence
Decision_Rationale: Credibility was central, yet no oral hearing was held, violating procedural fairness
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration officer conducting pre-removal risk assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide applicant with opportunity to present evidence orally
Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness standard applied to procedural fairness
